t: A*p pronouncement concerning Moab: Ar*pn in Moab is devastated, destroyed*ln in a night. Kir*ln in Moab is devastated, destroyed*ln in a night.
Dibon*ln went up to its temple to*ln weep at its high places. Moab*ln wails on Nebo and at Medeba. Every*ln head is shaved; every*ln beard is chopped short.
In*pn its streets they wear sackcloth; on*ln its rooftops and in its public squares everyone wails, falling*ln down and weeping.
Heshbon*ln and Elealeh cry out; their*ln voices are heard as far away as Jahaz. Therefore*ln the soldiers of Moab cry out, and*ln they tremble.

My*ln heart cries out over Moab, whose*ln fugitives flee as far as Zoar, to*ln Eglath-shelishiyah; they*ln go up the Ascent of Luhith weeping; they*ln raise a cry of destruction on*ln the road to Horonaim.
The*pn Waters of Nimrim are desolate; the*ln grass is withered, the foliage is gone, and*ln the vegetation has vanished.
So*ln they carry their wealth and belongings over*ln the Wadi of the Willows.
For*ln their cry echoes throughout*ln the territory of Moab. Their*ln wailing reaches Eglaim; their*ln wailing reaches Beer-elim.
The*ln Waters of Dibon are full of blood, but*ln I will bring on Dibon even more than this — a*ln lion for those who escape from Moab, and*ln for the survivors in the land.
